      • writeMessageHeader

        public abstract void writeMessageHeader(java.io.DataOutputStream stream,
                                        short sessionNo,
                                        int id,
                                        char type,
                                        char action,
                                        boolean toWait,
                                        boolean sendNow)
                                 throws java.io.IOException
        writeMessageHeader write the "standard" header portion of a message. * Each client/server message contains an initial standard set of fields: T_Version - char. version - char. T_Session_No - char sessionNo - short (unique for each session name). id - integer (unique for each sending thread). type - char (message type). action - char (message action). Each of these fields are sent over the connection via a DataOutputStream.
        Parameters:
        stream - the DataOutputStream to write the fields to.
        sessionNo - the unique session number for this message.
        id - the unique identifier for this sending thread.
        type - the message type.
        action - the message action.
        toWait - do we wait for a reply to this message?
        sendNow - if true, send this message out now, otherwise add it to a buffer of outgoing messages that will be retrieved by the receiver.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO exception has occured.
